availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: San Francisco, San Francisco County, California

p.orgName: City and County of San Francisco

body.p: I C J Brenham, duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner for the State of Kentucky, residing in the City of San Francisco, state of California, do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully perform all the duties of such Commissioner, under and by virtue of the laws of said State of Kentucky
Sworn to and subscribed before me this 14" day of June A D 1861.

E V Joice
Notary Public
JOICE NOTARY PUBLIC
EUREKA
SAN FRANCISCO CALIF

Oath of C. J. Brenham
Comr of Deeds
Filed July 17. 1861
